definition: to come off sentry duty/to lay off (a worker)/laid-off
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: The crazy part to think about this is there's so many people laid off.
sentences.chinese: 但一想到現在那麼多人都下崗了，還是有些令人抓狂。

sentences.english: No age limit older Americans seems, can not be laid-off workers work. U.
sentences.chinese: 美國老年人似乎不受年齡限制，能上崗工作就不下崗。

sentences.english: That has inevitably led to a large number of workers being laid off from overstaffed enterprises.
sentences.chinese: 此舉無疑使人員過剩的企業有大量工人下崗。

sentences.english: Policies and measures designed to encourage reemployment of laid-off workers must be conscientiously carried out.
sentences.chinese: 認真落實促進下崗失業人員再就業的各項政策措施。

sentences.english: Its 1950s-era textile mills are laying off workers.
sentences.chinese: 五十年代修建的紡織廠的工人們紛紛下崗。

sentences.english: His loftiness sends him into despair when deprived of his job.
sentences.chinese: 他的自命清高使他在下崗後陷入絕望的境地。

sentences.english: Each laid-off worker can receive a living wage.
sentences.chinese: 每個下崗工人可領取基本生活費。

sentences.english: The laid-off worker set up a vegetable stall in the morning market.
sentences.chinese: 這個下崗工人在早市上支起了一個菜攤。

sentences.english: As far as I know, more than million laid-off workers have found their new jobs.
sentences.chinese: 就我所知，一千多萬下崗工人已經找到了新的工作。

sentences.english: In some hard-hit areas, many laid-off workers are giving up searches.
sentences.chinese: 在一些深受打擊的區域中，許多下崗的工人放棄搜索。

sentences.english: Some workers in this factory is out of a job.
sentences.chinese: 這個工廠的一些工人下崗了。

sentences.english: To make that change, we had to lay off workers in the U. S.
sentences.chinese: 要完成這個改變，我們就需要讓美國的工人下崗。
不過，你下崗了，我會時刻想念你的，克里斯汀。

sentences.english: The anger of laid-off workers has long been one of officialdom's biggest worries.
sentences.chinese: 下崗職工的憤怒長期以來一直是官場最大的隱憂之一。

sentences.english: Nowadays more and more persons are out of work. They are called laid-off personnel.
sentences.chinese: 現在越來越多的人開始失業，他們被叫做下崗工人。

sentences.english: Louis's WTHR. "The crazy part to think about this is there's so many people laid off.
sentences.chinese: 但一想到現在那麼多人都下崗了，還是有些令人抓狂。

definition: to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)
to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
to start/to set in motion/to move/to march/to dig in (eating)/to tuck in (eating)
car or other vehicle (bicycle, truck etc)
to make up missed lesson/to reschedule a class
father's elder brother's wife/aunt (affectionate term for an elderly woman)
billowing smoke (idiom)/foul atmosphere/(fig.) murky atmosphere/in a turmoil
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
to serve in the army/to be a soldier
